trans-unit.source: Next steps for access management using groups | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Next steps for access management using groups | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Advanced How-to's for managing security groups and how to use these groups to manage access to a resource.
trans-unit.target: Advanced How-to's for managing security groups and how to use these groups to manage access to a resource.

trans-unit.source: Managing owners for a group
trans-unit.target: Managing owners for a group

trans-unit.source: Assigning owners to a group
trans-unit.target: Assigning owners to a group

trans-unit.source: To add an owner to a group in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To add an owner to a group in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click **Active Directory**, and then click the name of your organization’s directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click **Active Directory**, and then click the name of your organization’s directory.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Groups** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Groups** tab.

trans-unit.source: On the **Groups** page, click on the name of the group that you want to add owners to.
trans-unit.target: On the **Groups** page, click on the name of the group that you want to add owners to.

trans-unit.source: On that group’s page, click **Add Owners**.
trans-unit.target: On that group’s page, click **Add Owners**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Add owners** page, click the name of the user that you want to add as the owner of this group and make sure this name is added to the **Selected** pane.
trans-unit.target: On the **Add owners** page, click the name of the user that you want to add as the owner of this group and make sure this name is added to the **Selected** pane.

trans-unit.source: To remove an owner from a group from the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To remove an owner from a group from the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click **Active Directory**, and then click the name of your organization’s directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click **Active Directory**, and then click the name of your organization’s directory.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Groups** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Groups** tab.

trans-unit.source: On the **Groups** page, click the name of the group that you want to remove an owner from.
trans-unit.target: On the **Groups** page, click the name of the group that you want to remove an owner from.

trans-unit.source: On that group’s page, click the **Owners** tab.
trans-unit.target: On that group’s page, click the **Owners** tab.

trans-unit.source: On that group’s page, click the name of the owner that you want to remove from this group, and then click **Remove**.
trans-unit.target: On that group’s page, click the name of the owner that you want to remove from this group, and then click **Remove**.
